title: RadialMR
text: install RadialMR directly GitHub repository, first make sure devtools package installed: RadialMR package can installed using: update package just run remotes::install_github("WSpiller/RadialMR") command .

title: RadialMR
text: written RadialMR R package produce radial plots perform radial regression inverse variance weighted MR-Egger regression models. package contains total five functions: format_radial function used convert data frame containing summary data set format radial analyses. ivw_radial function fits radial inverse variance weighted (IVW) model using either first order, second order, modified second order weights. provides effect estimate allows outliers identified using Cochran’s Q-statistic. function now also includes iterative exact IVW estimation, described : Improving accuracy two-sample summary data Mendelian randomization: moving beyond NOME assumption(https://www.biorxiv.org/content/early/2018/07/02/159442). egger_radial function fits radial MR-Egger model using either first order, second order, modified second order weights. provides effect estimate allows outliers identified using Rucker’s Q-statistic. plotly_radial function produces interactive radial plots corresponding output ivw_radial egger_radial functions. plot_radial function produces radial plot corresponding output ivw_radial egger_radial functions. function provides range scaling aesthetic options showing either IVW estimate, MR-Egger estimate, estimates simultaneously. Radial plots produced many existing R packages metafor, numOSL, Luminescence. Care need taken, however, input data MR-analysis appropriately generic platforms. reason also continue develop RadialMR package produce radial plots conduct radial plot regression MR-setting.

title: RadialMR
text: paper published International Journal Epidemiology: Bowden, J., et al., Improving visualization, interpretation analysis two-sample summary data Mendelian randomization via Radial plot Radial regression. International Journal Epidemiology, 2018. 47(4): p. 1264-1278. https://doi.org/10.1093/ije/dyy101

what: Two Sample Summary GWAS data published in Do et al (2014). — data_radial
title: Two Sample Summary GWAS data published in Do et al (2014). — data_radial
text: dataset containing summary data GWAS data 185 independent SNPs respect lipid fractions coronary heart disease (CHD), previously published et al (2013). Lipid fractions include low-density lipoprotein (LDL-C),high-density lipoprotein (HDL-C), triglycerides, association estimates obtained Global Lipids Genetics Consortium (GLGC) (Willer et al, 2013). Summary data CHD obtained CARDIoGRAM study (Schunkert et al, 2011). Association estimates obtained regressing phenotype upon genetic variant additional adjusted covariates, links information related study presented .

title: Two Sample Summary GWAS data published in Do et al (2014). — data_radial
Two Sample Summary GWAS data published in Do et al (2014). — data_radial
text: data frame 185 rows 21 variables. Specifically includes following information: rsid identification number variant a1 reference allele variant a2 allele variant chr chromosome number variant located pos genomic position genetic variant relative chromosome number ldlcbeta association estimate genetic variant obtained regressing LDL-C upon genetic variant hdlcbeta association estimate obtained regressing HDL-C upon genetic variant tgbeta association estimate obtained regressing triglycerides upon genetic variant chdbeta association estimate CHD obtained regressing CHD upon genetic variant ldlcp2 p-value corresponding association estimate ldlcbeta hdlcp2 p-value corresponding association estimate hdlcbeta tgp2 p-value corresponding association estimate tgbeta chdp2 p-value corresponding association estimate chdbeta ldlcz z-score corresponding association estimate ldlcbeta ldlcse standard error corresponding association estimate ldlcbeta hdlcz z-score corresponding association estimate hdlcbeta hdlcse standard error corresponding association estimate hdlcbeta tgz z-score corresponding association estimate tgbeta tgse standard error corresponding association estimate tgbeta chdz z-score corresponding association estimate chdbeta chdse standard error corresponding association estimate chdbeta

title: Two Sample Summary GWAS data published in Do et al (2014). — data_radial
text: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3904346/ https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3838666/ https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3119261/

title: Two Sample Summary GWAS data published in Do et al (2014). — data_radial
text: data_radial

title: Two Sample Summary GWAS data published in Do et al (2014). — data_radial
text: Wes Spiller; Jack Bowden; Tom Palmer.

title: Two Sample Summary GWAS data published in Do et al (2014). — data_radial
egger_radial — egger_radial
text: Fits radial MR-Egger model using first order, second order, modified second order weights. Outliers identified using significance threshold specified user. function returns object class "egger", containing regression estimates, measure total heterogeneity using Rucker's Q statistic, individual contribution overall heterogeneity variant, data frame use constructing radial plot.

title: egger_radial — egger_radial
text: r_input formatted data frame using format_radial function, object class MRInput generated MendelianRandomization::mr_input data.frame single exposure-outcome pair generated TwoSampleMR::harmonise_data. alpha value specifying statistical significance threshold identifying outliers (0.05 specifies p-value threshold 0.05). weights value specifying inverse variance weights used calculate MR-Egger estimate Rucker's Q statistic. default modified second order weights used, one can choose select first order (1), second order (2) modified second order weights (3). summary logical argument (TRUE FALSE) indicating whether summary results heterogeneity presented (default= TRUE).

title: egger_radial — egger_radial
text: object class "egger" containing following components: coef matrix giving intercept slope coefficient, corresponding standard errors, t-statistics, (two-sided) p-values. qstatistic Rucker's Q statistic overall heterogeneity. df Degrees freedom. equal number variants -2 fitting radial MR-Egger model. outliers data frame containing variants identified outliers, respective Q statistics, chi-squared tests SNP identification. data data frame containing containing SNP IDs, inverse variance weights, product inverse variance weight ratio estimate variant, contribution overall heterogeneity corresponding p-value, factor indicator showing outlier status. confint vector giving lower upper confidence limits radial MR-Egger effect estimate.

title: egger_radial — egger_radial
text: Bowden, J., et al., Improving visualization, interpretation analysis two-sample summary data Mendelian randomization via Radial plot Radial regression. International Journal Epidemiology, 2018. 47(4): p. 1264-1278.

title: egger_radial — egger_radial
text: Wes Spiller; Jack Bowden; Tom Palmer.

title: egger_radial — egger_radial
code: # Example using format_radial data ldl.dat <- data_radial[data_radial[,10]<5e-8,]  ldl.fdat <- format_radial(ldl.dat[,6], ldl.dat[,9],                           ldl.dat[,15], ldl.dat[,21],                           ldl.dat[,1])  egger_radial(ldl.fdat, 0.05, 1, TRUE) #>  #> Radial MR-Egger #>  #>               Estimate Std. Error   t value     Pr(>|t|) #> (Intercept) -0.4303552  0.3244151 -1.326557 1.884296e-01 #> Wj           0.6129126  0.1109369  5.524877 3.988423e-07 #>  #> Residual standard error: 1.537 on 80 degrees of freedom #>  #> F-statistic: 30.52 on 1 and 80 DF, p-value: 3.99e-07 #> Q-Statistic for heterogeneity: 188.9285 on 80 DF , p-value: 8.445607e-11 #>  #>  Outliers detected  #>   # Example using TwoSampleMR format data if (FALSE) { if (require("TwoSampleMR", quietly = TRUE)) { # Example with one exposure-outcome pair bmi_exp_dat <- TwoSampleMR::extract_instruments(outcomes = 'ieu-a-2') chd_out_dat <- TwoSampleMR::extract_outcome_data(                                snps = bmi_exp_dat$SNP,                                outcomes = 'ieu-a-7') tsmrdat <- TwoSampleMR::harmonise_data(exposure_dat = bmi_exp_dat,                                    outcome_dat = chd_out_dat) egger_radial(r_input = tsmrdat, alpha = 0.05,              weights = 1, summary = TRUE) } }  # Example using MendelianRandomization format data if (require("MendelianRandomization", quietly = TRUE)) { dat <- data_radial[data_radial[,10] < 5e-8,] mrdat <- MendelianRandomization::mr_input(bx = dat$ldlcbeta,                                           bxse = dat$ldlcse,                                           by = dat$chdbeta,                                           byse = dat$chdse,                                           snps = dat$rsid) egger_radial(r_input = mrdat, alpha = 0.05,              weights = 1, summary = TRUE) } #>  #> Radial MR-Egger #>  #>               Estimate Std. Error   t value     Pr(>|t|) #> (Intercept) -0.4303552  0.3244151 -1.326557 1.884296e-01 #> Wj           0.6129126  0.1109369  5.524877 3.988423e-07 #>  #> Residual standard error: 1.537 on 80 degrees of freedom #>  #> F-statistic: 30.52 on 1 and 80 DF, p-value: 3.99e-07 #> Q-Statistic for heterogeneity: 188.9285 on 80 DF , p-value: 8.445607e-11 #>  #>  Outliers detected  #>

title: format_radial — format_radial
text: function restructures summary GWAS data downstream two-sample Mendelian randomization analyses. variant identification numbers provided, index vector generated corresponding ordering variants provided.

title: format_radial — format_radial
text: BXG numeric vector beta-coefficient values genetic associations first variable (exposure). BYG numeric vector beta-coefficient values genetic associations second variable (outcome). seBXG standard errors corresponding beta-coefficients BXG. seBYG standard errors corresponding beta-coefficients BYG. RSID vector names genetic variants included analysis. variant IDs provided (RSID = "NULL"), vector ID numbers generated.

title: format_radial — format_radial
text: function provides data frame containing following columns: SNP identification number variant beta.exposure association estimate genetic variant respect exposure beta.outcome association estimate genetic variant respect outcome se.exposure standard error variant-exposure association beta.exposure se.outcome standard error variant-outcome association beta.outcome

title: format_radial — format_radial
text: Bowden, J., et al., Improving visualization, interpretation analysis two-sample summary data Mendelian randomization via Radial plot Radial regression. International Journal Epidemiology, 2018. 47(4): p. 1264-1278.

title: format_radial — format_radial
text: Wes Spiller; Jack Bowden; Tom Palmer.

title: ivw_radial — ivw_radial
text: Fits radial inverse variance weighted (IVW) model using range weighting specifications. Outliers determined respect contribution global heterogeneity, quantified Cochran's Q-statistic, using significance threshold specified user. ivw_radial function returns object class "IVW", containing effect estimates, total estimated heterogeneity using Cochran's Q-statistic, individual contribution overall heterogeneity variant, data frame used downstream plotting functions plot_radial plotly_radial.

title: ivw_radial — ivw_radial
text: r_input formatted data frame using format_radial function, object class MRInput generated MendelianRandomization::mr_input data.frame single exposure-outcome pair generated TwoSampleMR::harmonise_data. alpha value specifying statistical significance threshold identifying outliers (0.05 specifies p-value threshold 0.05). weights value specifying inverse variance weights used calculate IVW estimate Cochran's Q statistic. default modified second order weights used, one can choose select first order (1), second order (2) modified second order weights (3). tol value indicating tolerance threshold performing iterative IVW approach. value represents minimum difference coefficients previous current iterations required iteration performed (default= 0.0001). summary logical argument (TRUE FALSE) indicating whether summary results heterogeneity presented (default= TRUE).

title: ivw_radial — ivw_radial
text: object class "IVW" containing following components: coef estimated coefficient, standard error, t-statistic corresponding (two-sided) p-value. qstatistic Cochran's Q statistic overall heterogeneity. df Degrees freedom. equal number variants -1 fitting radial IVW model. outliers data frame containing variants identified outliers, respective Q statistics, chi-squared tests SNP identification. data data frame containing containing SNP IDs, inverse variance weights, product inverse variance weight ratio estimate variant, contribution overall heterogeneity corresponding p-value, factor indicator showing outlier status. confint vector giving lower upper confidence limits radial IVW effect estimate. .coef estimated iterative coefficient, standard error, t-statistic corresponding (two-sided) p-value. .confint vector giving lower upper confidence limits iterative radial IVW effect estimate. fe.coef estimated fixed effect exact coefficient, standard error, t-statistic corresponding (two-sided) p-value. fe.confint vector giving lower upper confidence limits fixed effect exact radial IVW effect estimate. re.coef estimated random effect exact coefficient, standard error, t-statistic corresponding (two-sided) p-value. re.confint vector giving lower upper confidence limits random effect exact radial IVW effect estimate. mf mean F statistic set genetic variants, indicative instrument strength.

title: ivw_radial — ivw_radial
text: Bowden, J., et al., Improving visualization, interpretation analysis two-sample summary data Mendelian randomization via Radial plot Radial regression. International Journal Epidemiology, 2018. 47(4): p. 1264-1278.

title: ivw_radial — ivw_radial
text: Wes Spiller; Jack Bowden; Tom Palmer.

title: ivw_radial — ivw_radial
code: # Example using format_radial data ldl.dat <- data_radial[data_radial[,10]<5e-8,] ldl.fdat <- format_radial(ldl.dat[,6], ldl.dat[,9],                           ldl.dat[,15], ldl.dat[,21], ldl.dat[,1]) ivw_radial(ldl.fdat, 0.05, 1, 0.0001, TRUE) #>  #> Radial IVW #>  #>               Estimate  Std.Error   t value     Pr(>|t|) #> Effect (1st) 0.4874900 0.05830409  8.361163 6.210273e-17 #> Iterative    0.4873205 0.05827885  8.361874 6.172955e-17 #> Exact (FE)   0.4958973 0.03804168 13.035630 7.673061e-39 #> Exact (RE)   0.4910400 0.05490461  8.943512 1.025846e-13 #>  #>  #> Residual standard error: 1.544 on 81 degrees of freedom #>  #> F-statistic: 69.91 on 1 and 81 DF, p-value: 1.46e-12 #> Q-Statistic for heterogeneity: 193.0843 on 81 DF , p-value: 3.827332e-11 #>  #>  Outliers detected  #> Number of iterations = 3  # Example using TwoSampleMR format data if (FALSE) { if (require("TwoSampleMR", quietly = TRUE)) { # Example with one exposure-outcome pair bmi_exp_dat <- TwoSampleMR::extract_instruments(outcomes = 'ieu-a-2') chd_out_dat <- TwoSampleMR::extract_outcome_data(                                snps = bmi_exp_dat$SNP,                                outcomes = 'ieu-a-7') tsmrdat <- TwoSampleMR::harmonise_data(exposure_dat = bmi_exp_dat,                                    outcome_dat = chd_out_dat) ivw_radial(r_input = tsmrdat, alpha = 0.05,            weights = 1, tol = 0.0001, summary = TRUE) } }  # Example using MendelianRandomization format data if (require("MendelianRandomization", quietly = TRUE)) { dat <- data_radial[data_radial[,10] < 5e-8,] mrdat <- MendelianRandomization::mr_input(bx = dat$ldlcbeta,                                           bxse = dat$ldlcse,                                           by = dat$chdbeta,                                           byse = dat$chdse,                                           snps = dat$rsid) ivw_radial(r_input = mrdat, alpha = 0.05,            weights = 1, tol = 0.0001, summary = TRUE) } #>  #> Radial IVW #>  #>               Estimate  Std.Error   t value     Pr(>|t|) #> Effect (1st) 0.4874900 0.05830409  8.361163 6.210273e-17 #> Iterative    0.4873205 0.05827885  8.361874 6.172955e-17 #> Exact (FE)   0.4958973 0.03804168 13.035630 7.673061e-39 #> Exact (RE)   0.4910400 0.05642800  8.702064 3.086420e-13 #>  #>  #> Residual standard error: 1.544 on 81 degrees of freedom #>  #> F-statistic: 69.91 on 1 and 81 DF, p-value: 1.46e-12 #> Q-Statistic for heterogeneity: 193.0843 on 81 DF , p-value: 3.827332e-11 #>  #>  Outliers detected  #> Number of iterations = 3

title: Convert an object of class MRInput from the MendelianRandomization package to the RadialMR rmr_format class — mrinput_to_rmr_format
code: if (require("MendelianRandomization", quietly = TRUE)) { dat <- data_radial[data_radial[,10] < 5e-8,] dat <- MendelianRandomization::mr_input(bx = dat$ldlcbeta,                                         bxse = dat$ldlcse,                                         by = dat$chdbeta,                                         byse = dat$chdse,                                         snps = dat$rsid) dat <- mrinput_to_rmr_format(dat) head(dat) class(dat) } #> [1] "data.frame" "rmr_format"

title: plotly_radial — plotly_radial
text: function producing interactive radial IVW MR-Egger plots individually.function utilises output IVW_radial egger_radial functions.

title: plotly_radial — plotly_radial
text: r_object object class "IVW" "egger". TEST Logical; indicating whether testing function

title: plotly_radial — plotly_radial
text: plotly object containing radial plot either IVW MR-Egger estimates. Hovering mouse individual datapoints highlight corresponding SNP identification number observation.

title: plotly_radial — plotly_radial
text: Bowden, J., et al., Improving visualization, interpretation analysis two-sample summary data Mendelian randomization via Radial plot Radial regression. International Journal Epidemiology, 2018. 47(4): p. 1264-1278.

title: plotly_radial — plotly_radial
text: Wes Spiller; Jack Bowden; Tom Palmer.

title: plot_radial — plot_radial
text: function producing radial IVW MR-Egger plots either individually simultaneously. function allows variety aesthetic scaling options, utilising output IVW_radial egger_radial functions.

title: plot_radial — plot_radial
text: r_object object class "IVW" "egger". visualising estimates simultaneously, objects included vector c(,B), B denote "IVW" "egger" objects respectively. radial_scale Indicates whether produce plot including full radial scale (TRUE), scatterplot showing effect estimates (FALSE). show_outliers Indicates whether display set variants identified outliers (TRUE) complete set variants (FALSE). Note (show_outliers=TRUE), non-outlying variants origin furthest outlier cause error message one points omitted. non-outlying variants beyond scale. outliers present, plot produced using full set variants, accompanying message indicating absence outliers. scale_match Indicates whether x y axes range(TRUE), different ranges (FALSE) improves interpretation radial scale, set FALSE radial scale omitted plot.

title: plot_radial — plot_radial
text: ggplot object containing radial plot either IVW, MR-Egger, estimates simultaneously.

title: plot_radial — plot_radial
text: Bowden, J., et al., Improving visualization, interpretation analysis two-sample summary data Mendelian randomization via Radial plot Radial regression. International Journal Epidemiology, 2018. 47(4): p. 1264-1278.

title: plot_radial — plot_radial
text: Wes Spiller; Jack Bowden; Tom Palmer.

title: plot_radial — plot_radial
code: ldl.dat <- data_radial[data_radial[,10]<5e-8,] ldl.fdat <- format_radial(ldl.dat[,6], ldl.dat[,9],                           ldl.dat[,15], ldl.dat[,21], ldl.dat[,1]) ivw.object <- ivw_radial(ldl.fdat, 0.05, 1, 0.0001, TRUE) #>  #> Radial IVW #>  #>               Estimate  Std.Error   t value     Pr(>|t|) #> Effect (1st) 0.4874900 0.05830409  8.361163 6.210273e-17 #> Iterative    0.4873205 0.05827885  8.361874 6.172955e-17 #> Exact (FE)   0.4958973 0.03804168 13.035630 7.673061e-39 #> Exact (RE)   0.4910400 0.05439526  9.027258 7.016610e-14 #>  #>  #> Residual standard error: 1.544 on 81 degrees of freedom #>  #> F-statistic: 69.91 on 1 and 81 DF, p-value: 1.46e-12 #> Q-Statistic for heterogeneity: 193.0843 on 81 DF , p-value: 3.827332e-11 #>  #>  Outliers detected  #> Number of iterations = 3 plot_radial(ivw.object)

title: Convert a data.frame containing a single exposure - outcome pair generated by TwoSampleMR::harmonise_data() to the RadialMR rmr_format class — tsmr_to_rmr_format
code: if (FALSE) { if (require("TwoSampleMR", quietly = TRUE)) {   # Example with one exposure-outcome pair   bmi_exp_dat <- TwoSampleMR::extract_instruments(outcomes = 'ieu-a-2')   chd_out_dat <- TwoSampleMR::extract_outcome_data(     snps = bmi_exp_dat$SNP,     outcomes = 'ieu-a-7'   ) dat <- TwoSampleMR::harmonise_data(exposure_dat = bmi_exp_dat,                                    outcome_dat = chd_out_dat) dat <- tsmr_to_rmr_format(dat) class(dat) head(dat) } }
